page.title: 05Transport,Taxis,St Austell
page.content: In 1985 there are 21, taxis belonging to six firms,licensed by Restormel District Council and based at St.Austell Station.They pay rent to British Rail for parking spaces. The drivers are in contact with their offices by radio telephone so that requests for taxis are relayed to them.They also inform the office when they have a passenger and tell them their destination. Most of their journeys are within 3 to 4 miles radius of St. Austell and many are to Crinnis. They have been adversely affected by the introduction of the Hoppa Buses, particularly in loss of fares between the town and Boscoppa.
